channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Worried about AI taking your job? New Anthropic research shows it’s not that simple
item.description: Anthropic’s latest data suggests AI won’t wipe out work overnight—but it will redraw the map of who wins, who struggles, and how jobs actually change.

item.title: Exclusive: Former OpenAI policy chief creates nonprofit institute, calls for independent safety audits of frontier AI models
item.description: Former OpenAI policy head Miles Brundage debuts AVERI, an institute advocating for independent safety audits of top AI models

item.title: ‘They’re going to have to think and act a lot more like hotels’: The new rules of office space now that the ‘genie is out of the bottle on hybrid’
item.description: From cold plunges to nap pods to meditation rooms, many employers are turning to luxury to lure in their workers.

item.title: Oracle struggles to attract workers to Nashville ‘world HQ’—even with a 2-million-square-foot office and Larry Ellison’s favorite restaurant
item.description: Years after cofounder Larry Ellison declared Nashville its world headquarters, Oracle has added only a handful of workers.

item.title: Customers lament Tesla’s move toward monthly fees for self-driving cars: ‘You will own nothing and be happy’
item.description: Elon Musk announced Tesla would no longer allow outright purchases of self-driving software, and users aren't happy.

item.title: Mortgage rates fall to lowest level in over 3 years
Dow now pacing Thursday’s stock gains, as tech losing momentum in final hour
Nasdaq pacing stock-market rebound as Taiwan Semi earnings reignite AI trade
Young men worry about money, but believe they'll own a home. What gives?
Why Trump’s ‘Great Healthcare Plan’ strikes Wall Street as so underwhelming
